CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1952, pg. 14 reads: "Voting Disagreements Were Settled Amicably - Despite the heavy turnout of voters, most of the disagreements over who was eligible and who was not eligible to vote were peacefully settled either by conferences between Republican nad Democratic polling place officials such as is shown above. When there was doubt about registration qualifications, the complaining would-be voter was sent to Common Pleas Court which quickly adjusted his complaint.  In the picture at this Fifth Ward voting place are Elizabeth Anderson, Eva Morris, 2168 Webster Avenue; Daisy Lee Hall, 2176 Webster Avenue; Dewey Foulks, Alma Pulliam 705 Somers Street and Lucille Pettigrew, 619 Kirkpatrick Street. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Elizabeth Anderson, Eva Morris, Daisy Lee Hall, Dewey Foulks, Alma Pulliam, and Lucille Pettigrew standing in Fifth Ward polling place
